description: [CAF] The CAF 14th Extraordinary General Assembly will be live on all CAF digital platforms including YouTube (CAF TV) and CAFONLINE.com on Wednesday, 12 March 2025 from 10h00 Cairo time (08h00 GMT).
title: Africa: Watch Live - CAF 14th Extraordinary General Assembly in Cairo On Wednesday

description: [IPS] United Nations -- Faced with an impending cash crisis primarily due to non-payment of dues by the US and over 100 other member states- along with threats of a US withdrawal from the world body- there were widespread rumors the United Nations was re-costing and reducing its approved budget for 2025 while deciding to freeze hiring new staffers.
title: Africa: A Cash Crisis Forces UN to Re-Figure Its Budget and Freeze Staff Hiring

description: [ISS] Africa must look within to improve resource allocation and promote social impact investments that go beyond just boosting profits.
title: Africa: Can African Philanthropy Fill in for American Aid Cuts?

description: [UN News] States must do more to prevent cyberbullying and overcome unequal access to assistive technology from hampering the rights of persons with disabilities - particularly women and girls - the Human Rights Council has heard.
title: Africa: Women, Girls Bear Brunt of Cyberbullying Against Persons With Disabilities

description: [Liberian Observer] Former president Ellen Johnson Sirleaf believed that Africa cannot only achieve its 2063 agenda if more women are elected to offices, parliamentary leadership, and key decision-making roles.
title: Africa: Why Africa Needs More Female Leaders Now

description: [New Zimbabwe] Celebrated Zimbabwe international coach Calisto Pasuwa will be in for a big test as his side faces South Africa in the final African Nations Championships (CHAN) qualifying match.
title: Africa: Pasuwa's Malawi to Face South Africa in Final CHAN Qualifying Round

description: [allAfrica] Fertile Ground Studio is set to shake up the cinematic landscape with  I Am King , a gripping dystopian thriller rooted in the complexities of modern-day Africa. Bold, thought-provoking, and unflinching in its storytelling, the film will make its much-anticipated premiere at this year's  Johannesburg Film Festival , promising audiences a fresh and unapologetic narrative that challenges the status quo.
title: Africa: Fertile Ground Studio Presents I Am King - A Groundbreaking African Dystopian Thriller Premiering at the Johannesburg Film Festival

description: [allAfrica] In the fight against HIV, one of the most vulnerable populations is often overlooked - newborn babies
title: Africa: New Delivery, New Hope - Dissolving HIV Prevention Drug Works For Newborn Babies

description: [UN News] A "new black market" for synthetics and drug trafficking through war zones are fuelling instability around the world, the chief of the UN drugs and crime office said on Monday.
title: Africa: Drug Traffickers Running Routes Through War Zones, Top UN Official Warns

description: [New Zimbabwe] Health, education and a range of other sectors in Zimbabwe and the rest of Africa that were benefiting from USAID might just be in for a long, grueling run following announcements that 83% of the agency's programmes had been suspended.
title: Africa: No Hope for Zimbabwe, Africa As U.S. Shuts Down 83% of USAID Programmes

description: [Premium Times] The US government has also cancelled 5,200 contracts initially awarded by the agency to several organisations.
title: Africa: U.S. Govt Ends 83% of USAID Programmes, Cancels 5,200 Contracts

description: [Stellenbosch University] San Francisco -- The PETITE-DTG study evaluated dolutegravir (DTG) -- a drug that revolutionized HIV treatment in adults and children -- in infants less than 28 days old, using a pediatric 5 mg dispersible tablet (DTG-DT) and a novel 5 mg oral dispersible Film (DTG-Film).
title: Africa: New Dosing Guidance for Dolutegravir Allows Neonates Born to Mothers with HIV to Access this ARV Drug for the First Time - CROI Research

description: [IMF] Improving the business environment, strengthening governance, and reforming the labor market are among the keys to economic success
title: Africa: Boosting Growth and Prosperity in South Africa

description: [IFJ] The Federation deplores the growing hostility to gender equality and women's rights, with far-right movements threatening decades of progress. The organisation urges media professionals, trade unions, and governments to reinforce their commitment to the Beijing Declaration's goals, including those related to the media.
title: Africa: IFJ Calls for 'Gender-Equal Media for a Gender-Equal Future'

description: [Global Fund] Ending AIDS, malaria and tuberculosis (TB) is within reach. But the gains we have made against these diseases over the last two decades, the lives saved, the health and community systems built, are now in jeopardy as the U.S. government looks poised to retreat from its leadership in global health. This is precisely the wrong time to step back; instead, it is the moment to double down.
title: Africa: Ending Aids, Malaria and TB Is an Urgent Imperative

description: [The Conversation Africa] Five years ago, at the start of 2020, I was looking forward to the publication of my book, Terraformed: Young Black Lives in the Inner City and eagerly anticipating a long-awaited holiday to Jamaica.
title: Africa: Three Memorable Ways the Covid Pandemic Shaped Black Music - Five Years On

description: [The Conversation Africa] On March 11, 2020, as COVID continued to spread rapidly around the globe, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declared a pandemic.
title: Africa: 5 Years Since Covid Was Declared a Pandemic, We're Still Poorly Prepared for the Next One

description: [UN News] Gender equality is a critical goal at a time when the demand for rights faces a global backlash, top UN officials told thousands of diplomats, business and civil society delegates gathered at UN Headquarters in New York on Monday for the world's largest annual conference focused on women's issues.
title: Africa: World's Largest Conference On Women Calls for Equality Amid Gender Backlash

description: [VOA] Nairobi -- A British charity for the disabled, citing World Bank data, says the world could gain trillions annually in Gross Domestic Product if women were employed at the same rate as men. Failure to close gender employment gaps reduces a country's economic growth by 20% on average, according to the data.
title: Africa: UK Charity Calls to Close Gender Employment Gap for Disabled
